title: Beekeepers flag adulteration as biggest challenge at apiculture conference in Bengaluru
content: Students of University of Agricultural Sciences-Bangalore displayed self-made products from honey, like honey banana spread, gulab jamun, cookies, lip balm, soaps, and candles

title: Madras High Court stays ED’s attachment of director Shankar’s properties
content: Justices M.S. Ramesh and N. Senthilkumar say the ED ought not to have passed the provisional attachment order when court had stayed criminal proceedings and dismissed a civil suit

title: Majority of Indian-Americans feel U.S.-India relationship would have been stronger under Harris: survey
content: The survey examines attitudes around some of the foreign policy issues that appear to have impacted the diaspora in the 2024 election cycle

title: Skeletal remains found in suitcase near church cemetery at Kollam in Kerala
content: According to police, skeletal remains were in a decomposed state and not all bones were found. They said that it is likely that someone placed the remains in the suitcase and buried it at the site

title: 13 of world’s 20 most polluted cities in India; Delhi most polluted capital: report
content: Assam's Byrnihat tops global pollution list; four cities in neighbouring Pakistan and one in China are among the 20

title: U.S. Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard to visit India
content: This will be Ms. Gabbard’s first trip to India after taking over as the eighth Senate-confirmed and first female combat veteran Director of National Intelligence (DNI) in the second Trump administration

title: West Bengal Speaker suspends BJP MLA, orders eviction of two others
content: This comes weeks after the Speaker suspended four BJP MLAs including Leader of the Opposition Suvendu Adhikari for the entire Budget session on February 19

title: PM Modi arrives in Mauritius on two-day state visit, receives ceremonial welcome
content: PM Modi was welcomed by the deputy PM, Chief Justice of Mauritius, Speaker of the National Assembly, Leader of the Opposition, Foreign Minister, Cabinet Secretary, Chairperson of Grand Port District Council and many others.

title: How the Bangalore Palace (Utilisation and Regulation of Land) Bill will help Karnataka government bypass Supreme Court ruling
content: The legislation arises out of the nearly a decade-old contempt case over the Bangalore Palace Grounds, which the Karnataka government has been fighting with the erstwhile royal family of Mysuru in the Supreme Court

title: Parliament Budget Session Day 2 LIVE updates: LS takes up Question Hour; RS adjourned till 12 p.m. amid Opposition protests
content: Day 1 of the Parliament Budget Session witnessed disruptions over the alleged ‘Hindi’ language imposition

title: Jewellery store robbed in Bihar’s Ara, two arrested after gunfight with police
content: Six armed robbers overpowered the staff at gunpoint, locked the shutter and held employees hostage for more than 30 minutes before fleeing with valuables, the police said

title: Move to appoint Professors of Practice in govt. engineering colleges opposed
content: While opponents say the move runs counter to government rules, supporters say imparting practical industry knowledge will benefit students

title: A transport hub in Bengaluru that lacks integration, basic facilities and suffers from safety concerns
content: As the Karnataka Budget for 2025-26 has announced plans for the redevelopment of the Kempegowda Bus Station at Majestic, The Hindu, in a six part series, will explore the various facets of the pete area. This is the second story in the series

title: A.P. CM tells officials to ensure 100% quality in service delivery and zero corruption
content: The government is planning promote ‘work from home’ in the State, he says, adding that village and ward secretariat are conducting a survey on the model

title: ₹7.98 lakh sanctioned for Knowledge Mission’s ‘Pride’
content: Kerala’s Social Justice department allocates funds for Pride project, providing job training to transgender community for diversity inclusion

title: Jwala self-defence training at Karyavattom
content: Join Jwala 3.0 self-defence training for women and children at University of Kerala, Karyavattom campus on Tuesday

title: Full marks for English paper question No 7 in view of printing inconsistency: BIE
content: BIE awards full marks for Second Year English question 7 due to printing inconsistencies, ensuring fairness for all students

title: A.P. govt. plans to create ‘Quantum Valley’, says Chandrababu Naidu
content: Andhra Pradesh plans to establish a ‘Quantum Valley’ with a task force to lead in quantum computing advancements

title: Oncologist Nori Dattatreyudu’s contribution to society is remarkable, says A.P. CM
content: Land has been allotted to set up a cancer hospital in Amaravati, similar to Basavatarakam Indo-American Hospital in Hyderabad, says Naidu

title: Lok Sabha passes Bills of Lading Bill aimed to simplify shipping
content: Union Minister Sarbananda Sonowal termed it a historic milestone in India’s journey towards a modern, efficient, and globally competitive shipping sector

title: IIOR organises industry meet on new oilseeds varieties, technologies
content: IIOR director R.K. Mathur stated that the industry meet was organised to introduce new innovations to stakeholders and for awareness among the industries based on oilseeds

title: Malhar certified meat for Hindus | All you need to know about Maharashtra government’s move
content: Government launches Malhar certification for Jhatka meat, ensuring adherence to Hindu traditions and empowering Hindu community vendors

title: Four southern districts likely to experience heavy rainfall on March 11
content: Isolated places in Kanniyakumari, Tenkasi, Tirunelveli and Thoothukudi districts may receive heavy to very heavy rainfall. Chennai is likely to get light to moderate rainfall in some areas on March 11

title: Zambian delegation visits cooperatives in Rajasthan
content: The four-member Zambian delegation, which visited the Jaipur Central Cooperative Bank and other institutions, witnessed the activities for making various cooperative schemes accessible to the public at large

title: Playing with language of Tamil Nadu, its education, and rights is equivalent to kindling fire: Udhayanidhi Stalin
content: Making such a statement about the MPs from Tamil Nadu was equivalent to insulting the people of the State who had voted for these MPs, says Deputy CM

title: Centre sees increase in foodgrain production
content: Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said the Centre is continuously working towards the development of the sector and is providing assistance and encouragement to farmers through various schemes

title: New tariffs not yet officially imposed by the U.S., Commerce Secretary tells parliamentary panel
content: Members of the Parliamentary Standing Committee on External Affairs questioned India’s muted response to American President Donald Trump’s statements on tariffs

title: Over six lakh cases identified under 100-day TB control campaign: Health Ministry data
content: India has the world’s largest TB epidemic and continues to be a major public health problem; the World Health Organisation states that the country’s TB incidence has declined by 17.7% from 2015 to 2023

title: Two children among five people charred to death after fire breaks out at Jharkhand cracker shop
content: The tragic incident took place in Godarmana market of Garhwa district near the border of Jharkhand and Chhattisgarh where one of the two children tried to light up a cracker at a firecracker shop; the shopkeeper was also one of the deceased in the blaze

title: New Delhi considers restoring High Commissioner to Canada to reset ties
content: A new Canadian PM spells reset opportunity for ties hit by Nijjar killing, say former Indian, Canadian diplomats; last week, PM-designate Carney spoke of ‘opportunities to rebuild’ ties with India as Canada diversifies trade ties amid Trump’s tariffs

title: Student writes to PM opposing participation of V-C and two others in today’s convocation
content: Nandappa has said that these three have been accused in an atrocities case and that a trial is under way in a Kalaburagi District Court

title: Greater Bengaluru Governance Bill passed amidst protest and walkout by Opposition
content: Congress defends decentralisation and says unless Bengaluru administration is restructured, it cannot address the problems as each area had different issues

title: Idukki administration demolishes cross erected on encroached land on Parunthumpara hills
content: Case registered against Changanassery native. District Collector says the cross was erected on government land. The administration will take strict action against those who violate the prohibitory order imposed in the area for preventing encroachments

title: Protest against alleged attack on religious procession in Rayachoti
content: Viswa Hindu Parishad members demand suspension of Sub-Inspector who has reportedly filed cases only on the Hindus while the clash was between two religious groups

title: South Central Railway and the wait for the ‘Pink Book’
content: There has been an unusual delay in the release of the ‘Pink Book’  which indicates the precise details of new services, works, funds allocation etc., for zones across the country

title: Delhi court says Sharjeel Imam was ‘one of the kingpins’ inciting violence during 2019 anti-CAA protests
content: ‘Even if the mob does not indulge in violence and arson while enforcing chakka jaam, it would still be a violent act by one section of society against the other,’ the court said

title: Talks yield no result, highways remain blocked in Manipur
content: Government officials say ‘free movement’ of vehicles will resume once situation normalises; Kuki-Zo groups say the indefinite shutdown will continue

title: Telangana facing a low birth weight epidemic, says expert
content: The high incidence of low birth weight means that many children are starting life at a disadvantage, with increased risks of severe malnutrition and associated health complications, UNICEF regional head said

title: INDIA bloc was only meant for 2024 Lok Sabha election: Prakash Karat
content: It was a State-wise electoral understanding for the Lok Sabha polls and it yielded good results, says CPI(M) Polit Bureau coordinator. He says ‘nobody has given any thought’ to what the alliance should be post-2024.

title: Medical Education Minister warns disciplinary action against doctors who take up private practice during working hours
content: They have to mandatorily work from 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. and strict instructions have been given in this regard: Minister

title: Amid police deployment, Jadavpur University administration meets students
content: Earlier, protesting students have set March 10 deadline for talks on their demands, which include holding union elections

title: Police arrest man from Andhra Pradesh, recover ₹30 lakh in cash from him
content: The Haveri Police have solved a case of burglary with the arrest of the 28-year-old accused and recovery of the cash from him

title: Tracking NFL free agency: Live updates on every signing, trade, cut and rumor
content: We're following NFL signings, trades and cuts for 2025 free agency, including news around Najee Harris.

title: Source: 49ers to release Juszczyk after 8 seasons
content: The 49ers informed Pro Bowl fullback Kyle Juszczyk on Monday night that he is being released, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Monday.

title: Redick riled up as limping Lakers fall to Nets
content: Los Angeles star Luka Doncic logged his second triple-double with his new club, posting 22 points, 12 assists and 12 rebounds, but he also had five turnovers as the short-handed Lakers fell to the Brooklyn Nets 111-108 on Monday night at Barclays Center.

title: Yankees ace Cole will have Tommy John surgery
content: On Tuesday in Los Angeles, Yankees right-hander Gerrit Cole will undergo Tommy John surgery, the team announced, ending his season before it began and leaving New York staggering from another blow as it prepares to defend its American League pennant.

title: Sources: Rams to release Kupp if no trade made
content: The Los Angeles Rams plan to release wide receiver Cooper Kupp when the NFL's new season starts March 12 if they are unable to find a trade partner, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Monday.

title: 'Blessed' Bueckers makes Big East tourney history
content: UConn superstar Paige Bueckers lifted the 1-seed Huskies to a 70-50 victory over 2-seed Creighton in the Big East tournament championship game to claim the program's 30th conference tournament title -- the most in Division I history -- and 12th straight.

title: Sources: Darnold to Seahawks on $100.5M deal
content: The Seahawks found their replacement for Geno Smith, agreeing to a 3-year, $100.5 million deal with QB Sam Darnold, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Sources: Ex-Jets, Broncos QB Wilson to Dolphins
content: Free agent quarterback Zach Wilson reached agreement with the Dolphins on a one-year, $6 million, fully guaranteed deal that could grow to $10 million.

title: Rangers cap with vulgarity taken off team's store
content: A hat was pulled from the Rangers and MLB online stores after a mashup of the team's cap and jersey logos created the appearance of a vulgar word in Spanish.

title: No. 1 seeds, conference tournament stakes, more men's Champ Week storylines
content: It's Auburn vs. Duke, other 1-seed possibilities and teams with the most at stake in their conference tournaments as Champ Week heats up.

title: Women's Bracketology: Gonzaga upset, likely to miss NCAA tournament for first time since 2016
content: The 1-seeds and top 16 are set. But a trio of upsets to No. 1 conference seeds sent shock waves throughout the rest of the bracket.

title: Olney: Yankees must replace Gerrit Cole -- but they'll probably have to wait
content: Fans might want a big splash after New York lost its ace, but the right fit emerging could be months away.

title: Sources: Eagles trading QB Pickett to Browns
content: The Eagles are trading quarterback Kenny Pickett to the Browns for a 2025 fifth-round pick and quarterback Dorian Thompson-Robinson, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Monday.

title: Sources: Bills bolster receiving corps with Palmer
content: The Bills have reached agreement with former Chargers wide receiver Joshua Palmer on a three-year, $36 million deal, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Panthers' Horn gets historic deal for DB
content: Jaycee Horn has reached a four-year deal that averages $25 million per season, making him the highest-paid defensive back in NFL history, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Lions to sign CB Reed to replace Davis
content: The Detroit Lions have agreed to a three-year, $48 million contract with free agent cornerback D.J. Reed, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Sources: Chiefs sign OL Moore for 2 years, $30M
content: The Chiefs have agreed to a two-year, $30 million contract with four-year veteran tackle Jaylon Moore, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Sources: Godwin returns to Bucs on 3-year deal
content: Chris Godwin, who had the most receptions through the first seven weeks of the 2024 season before getting hurt, has reached a deal with the Bucs, the team said.

title: DE Reddick reaches deal with Bucs, sources say
content: Defensive end Haason Reddick has agreed to terms on a one-year deal for $14 million, including $12 million guaranteed, with the Buccaneers.

title: Sources: Mack returns to Chargers on $18M deal
content: The Los Angeles Chargers and Khalil Mack, former NFL Defensive Player of the Year, have agreed to a one-year fully guaranteed $18 million deal, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: MLS Power Rankings: Miami stay on top as Galaxy in free fall
content: The reigning MLS Cup champions are bottom of the league, so it's little wonder the Galaxy are tumbling down the order of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Arsenal's title race ends with Man United draw, Real Madrid win ugly: Marcotti explains the weekend
content: Did Arsenal give up in the title race with Sunday's draw at struggling Man United? PLUS: Real Madrid get booed, but also get the three points as Gab Marcotti explains the weekend.

title: Liverpool's No. 1 conundrum: Alisson or Kelleher to make way for Mamardashvili?
content: It's a good problem to have, but Arne Slot must decide which goalkeeper will be Liverpool's No. 1 next season.

title: Slot: PSG 'most complete' team Liverpool faced
content: Liverpool head coach Arne Slot has said his team will need to deliver their best performance of the season against Paris Saint-Germain if they are to book their place in the quarterfinals of the Champions League.

title: Man City sack Taylor five days before cup final
content: Manchester City women have sacked head coach Gareth Taylor just five days before their League Cup final match against Chelsea, the club confirmed on Monday.

title: Robinson wants Fulham stay amid reports of move
content: United States star Antonee Robinson has told ESPN he is ignoring speculation over his future and wants to play in European competitions with Fulham.

title: Ronaldo, Duran send Al Nassr to ACL quarterfinals
content: Al Nassr's Jhon Duran scored twice and Cristiano Ronaldo netted a penalty as the Saudi Pro League side booked a place in the Asian Champions League Elite last eight on Monday with a 3-0 win over Iran's Esteghlal.

title: Santi, Jiménez lead Mexico Nations League squad
content: Mexico national team head coach Javier Aguirre announced the 23-player roster for the upcoming Concacaf Nations League matches during the March international window, with Raul Jimenez and Santiago Gimenez headlining the squad.

title: Ratcliffe backs Amorim, at United 'for a long time'
content: Manchester United co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe has given his backing to manager Ruben Amorim and said the Portuguese coach will remain at the club "for a long time."

title: PSG's Kvaratskhelia: Anfield trip 'most important'
content: Paris Saint-Germain forward Khvicha Kvaratskhelia has described his team's visit to Anfield in the Champions League as the "most important" game of their season.

title: Fury, Rooney to manage England Soccer Aid side
content: Former heavyweight world champion Tyson Fury and ex-Manchester United and England forward Wayne Rooney will join forces to co-manage the England Soccer Aid side at Old Trafford in June.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Mohamed Salah open to Barcelona move
content: With his Liverpool contract close to expiring, Barcelona have emerged as surprise contenders for Mohamed Salah's signature. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Ferrari's debut winners: Can Lewis Hamilton join list of legends?
content: Some of the biggest names in F1 history have won in their debuts with Ferrari, a feat Lewis Hamilton will look to replicate on Sunday in Australia.

title: A reason to root for each driver, a question facing every team
content: Before the season kicks off, we bring you a reason to root for all 20 drivers, and the issues facing all 10 teams.

title: Timothée Chalamet, Kylie and Kendall Jenner attend BNP Paribas Open third round
content: Chalamet, and the Jenners were spotted during the Holger Rune-Ugo Humbert match, which Rune won 5-7, 6-4, 7-5, at Indian Wells on Sunday.

title: Days After Man's Death, Video Shows Daughters Beating Him
content: Days after a man in Madhya Pradesh's Morena was found hanging dead, a chilling video that shows his daughters assaulting him as his wife holds him down has emerged on social media

title: After Massive Cyberattack Hits X, Elon Musk Claims A Ukraine Link
content: Elon Musk has alleged that the massive cyberattack that targeted his social media platform, X (formerly Twitter), had digital traces originating from Ukraine.

title: 13 Of World's 20 Most Polluted Cities In India, Delhi Most Polluted Capital
content: Thirteen of the world's top 20 most polluted cities are in India, with Byrnihat in Assam topping the list, according to a new report published on Tuesday.

title: Angry PCB Rejects ICC's Explanation Over Pak Officials' Snub At CT Ceremony
content: BCCI president Roger Binny presented the white jackets to India players and the medals to match officials, while ICC chairman Jay Shah handed the trophy to skipper Rohit Sharma and gave the medals to the winners.

title: Massive Sell-Off In US Markets, $4 Trillion Wiped Out Since Last Month Peak
content: Share markets across the globe witnessed sharp losses after a selloff in America, triggered by US President Donald Trump on Monday refusing to rule out the suggestion that his tariffs could trigger a recession in the world's biggest economy.

title: After Israeli Woman Gang-Raped In Karnataka, Raids Across Hotels, Homestays
content: Days after an Israeli tourist's gang-rape near World Heritage site of Hampi in Karnataka, the police have increased night patrolling and launched raids on hotels, assuring better security amid a reported outflow of foreign tourists from the state.

title: Ramayana Conference, Sacred Lake: When PM Modi Visited Mauritius In 1998
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate over 20 India-funded projects, ranging from capacity building to community-linked infrastructure, during his two-day state visit to Mauritius.

title: Last Person To See Missing Indian Student On Dominican Beach Changes Account
content: Sudiksha Konanki was vacationing with five friends at the Riu Republica Resort in Punta Cana when she went missing

title: Tesla Shares Plunge 15% Amid Market Sell-Off, Steepest Drop Since 2020
content: Stocks of Elon Musk's Tesla plummeted by more than 15 per cent on Monday, its largest single-day decline in several years amid a broad-based market sell-off sparked by potential recession concerns and uncertainty over President Donald Trump's tariff.

title: Pet Pitbull 'Oreo' Shoots Owner Who Was In Bed With Girlfriend
content: A Tennessee man was lying in bed early Monday morning when his dog accidentally shot at him. According to the Memphis Police Department, officers responded to an accidental injury call just before 4 am in the 700 block of Whitney Avenue.

title: UK Air Force Facing Pilot Shortage As Diversity Hiring Backfires: Report
content: Under Air Chief Marshal Sir Mike Wigston's tenure, the RAF pledged to having 40 per cent women and 20 per cent of personnel from ethnic minorities.

title: Rohit Sharma's Honest Dubai Venue Admission Amid 'Advantage' Row
content: Team India was constantly accused of getting 'undue advantage' by playing all their matches in Dubai during the Champions Trophy.

title: PM Narendra Modi Arrives In Mauritius For 2-Day State Visit: 10 Points
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi landed on Port Louis on Tuesday for a two-day state visit to Mauritius, during which he will attend the island nation's 57th national day celebrations as the guest of honour.

title: "If India Played In Pakistan...": Akram Ends All Debate, Gives Final Verdict
content: Pakistan legend Wasim Akram gave his opinion on what would've happened had India played the Champions Trophy in Pakistan.

title: All About Vanuatu: Island Nation That Cancelled Lalit Modi's Passport
content: The Vanuatu government cancelled the passport issued to Indian Premier League (IPL) founder Lalit Modi, saying that escaping extradition was not a legitimate reason for citizenship in the island nation.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Hunted Down, Massacred, Syria's Alawites Ask India For Help
content: Ali Koshmr, a 36-year-old man from Syria's Latakia, around 330 km from Damascus, woke up to the sounds of gunfire, tires screeching and dozens of armed men shouting, "Come out, you Alawite pigs, Nusayris!"

title: 'Sobbed uncontrollably': Ranya Rao claims harassment during gold smuggling probe
content: In a high-profile gold smuggling case, prime accused Ranya claims she was verbally threatened during DRI interrogation but not physically harmed. DRI officials dispute her account, stating that questioning was recorded and focused on her travel history. The court will review the interrogation videos for any misconduct and Ranya’s non-cooperation is noted.

title: $4 trillion wiped from US stocks: What's behind market panic
content: US stocks experienced a significant decline on Monday, driven by ongoing tariff disputes and the potential for a federal government shutdown. Key factors include high stock valuations, economic uncertainty, and disappointing corporate earnings. Technology stocks, like Tesla, faced severe losses. Investors are keeping a close watch on inflation reports, interest rate policies, and government actions to stabilize the economy.

title: Watch: PM Modi receives traditional Bihari welcome in Mauritius
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received a warm welcome in Mauritius, marked by a traditional Geet Gawai performance. During his visit, Modi will participate in National Day celebrations and inaugurate various India-funded projects, highlighting bilateral ties and mutual cooperation between India and Mauritius.

title: 'Will buy a new one tomorrow': Trump defends Musk after Tesla shares take a hit
content: US President Donald Trump has voiced support for Elon Musk, praising his contributions to the nation amid claims that 'Radical Left Lunatics' are boycotting Tesla to harm Musk. Trump announced plans to buy a Tesla to show solidarity with Musk, who has been appointed by Trump to head the Department of government efficiency. Critics dub Musk as the unofficial 'Co-President.'

title: Exclusive: 'Koi bhi situation mei bhejo, karke aaunga' - Shreyas Iyer
content: Shreyas Iyer celebrated India's Champions Trophy win with an impromptu dance, highlighting his journey through a year of highs and lows. Despite past setbacks, including losing a central contract, he emerged as India's top run-scorer in the tournament, emphasizing his resilience and importance to the team.

title: Meet Roshni Nadar, HCL founder's daughter, who is now India's richest woman
content: Roshni Nadar Malhotra has ascended to become India's richest woman and third-richest individual overall after inheriting a 47% stake from her father, Shiv Nadar, in HCL Corporation and Vama Sundari Investments. She now holds significant control over HCL, steering its leadership and philanthropic ventures.

title: Man who foresaw 2008 crash has buy call on India!
content: Jim Walker forecasts a 10% decline in the U.S. dollar by 2025 and expects an economic slowdown, though manageable. He is optimistic about copper's long-term prospects due to green energy demand and strongly recommends increased investment in Indian equities.

title: Kerala BJP leader says nearly 400 Christian girls lost to ‘love jihad’
content: Former Poonjar MLA PC George urged Christian parents to marry off their daughters before they turn 24, citing an increase in 'love jihad' incidents. He claimed around 400 girls were lost to this in Meenachil taluk, with only 41 returned. Recently granted bail for a hate speech case, George also mentioned a large seizure of explosives in Erattupetta.

title: BJP leader injected with poison by assailants at Sambhal farmhouse, dies
content: A local BJP leader in Uttar Pradesh’s Sambhal district, Gulfam Singh Yadav, was killed after three men allegedly injected him with a poisonous substance at his farm. The assailants fled the scene, and Yadav died while being taken to Aligarh for treatment. Police are investigating but have not yet received a formal complaint from the victim's family.

title: Why Tesla’s stock drop won’t cost Elon Musk his world's richest title
content: Tesla’s stock has been declining each week since Musk took on the position of leading the Department of Government Efficiency, which is overseeing efforts to cut federal spending and reduce the government workforce. Elon Musk saw his net worth decrease by $29 billion due to a significant drop in Tesla's stock. Despite potential impacts of his government-related activities on Tesla's stock, Musk retains his position as the world's richest man, with substantial wealth from SpaceX and other ventures.

title: Ex-Philippine president Duterte arrested for 'crimes against humanity'
content: Former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte was arrested at Manila's airport upon his return from Hong Kong, following ICC directives for an investigation into his aggressive anti-drug campaign. The ICC is examining potential crimes against humanity during Duterte's tenure as mayor of Davao and president.

title: 'Hum koi retire nahi ho rahe hain': Rohit, Virat's stump mic chat
content: India won the ICC Champions Trophy 2025, beating New Zealand in the final. Amid speculation about their retirement, Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli dismissed rumors, with Rohit stating they had no plans to retire from ODIs. Sharma's match-winning 76 runs played a key role in the final. Rohit played a crucial role in the final, scoring a match-winning 76 against New Zealand.

title: Starlink fight for Ukraine: Angry Elon Musk to Polish FM, '...small man. You ...'
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio and Elon Musk confronted Polish Foreign Minister Radoslaw Sikorski regarding claims about Starlink's reliability in Ukraine. Rubio dismissed Sikorski's concerns as baseless, while Musk emphasized Poland's minimal financial contribution and reaffirmed the unwavering support of Starlink for Ukraine.

title: Why is US trying to deport green-card holder Khalil? Five questions answered
content: A US judge halted the deportation of Palestinian student Mahmoud Khalil, detained by immigration officials executing a State Department directive to cancel his green card. Khalil, involved in Columbia University's Gaza ceasefire protests, awaits further legal proceedings. The case raises debates on free speech and legal grounds for deportation amidst national security concerns.

title: Complaint filed against Thalapathy Vijay over Iftar event controversy
content: A complaint has been filed against actor Vijay for allegedly disrespecting Muslims at an Iftar event in Chennai. The Tamil Nadu Sunnath Jamaat highlighted the inclusion of unrelated individuals and poor organization as the main issues. They seek legal action to prevent future incidents, emphasizing that their intent is to uphold respect and dignity.

title: Kerala teen on this diet dies of anorexia
content: An 18-year-old Kerala girl died after surviving on water for six months, leading to severe malnutrition and anorexia. Weighing just 24 kg, she was admitted to the ICU but did not recover. Anorexia nervosa, a serious eating disorder, causes extreme weight loss and serious health complications. The condition requires urgent medical and psychological intervention.

title: Who is Tarun Raju? Businessman's role being probed in Ranya Rao gold smuggling case
content: A gold-smuggling racket involving Kannada actor Ranya Rao, daughter of a senior IPS officer, has prompted the arrest of her friend Tarun K Raju. This has led to a political uproar and a demand for a state government probe into the misuse of police protocol services at the airport.

title: 'Had India played in Pakistan, they ... ': Wasim Akram on venue controversy
content: India's success in the Champions Trophy, played entirely in Dubai, stirred debate regarding an unfair advantage. However, Wasim Akram dismissed these concerns, asserting India's dominance in global tournaments. India claimed the Champions Trophy by defeating New Zealand, marking their second ICC title in nine months, remaining unbeaten throughout both tournaments, showcasing their depth and leadership.

title: Tide may turn for IPL rejects who lit up Champions Trophy
content: Several standout players from the ICC Champions Trophy caught the attention of IPL franchise scouts and owners with their exceptional performances. Cricketers like Ben Duckett, Tom Latham, and Matt Henry, who went unsold in the mega auction last November, now appear as attractive prospects for IPL 2025 replacement signings.

title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex sinks over 400 points; Nifty50 below 22,350
content: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Tuesday. While BSE Sensex sunk over 400 points, Nifty50 was below 22,350.

title: ICC issues statement on PCB official's absence at Champions Trophy final
content: The PCB faced criticism from former players for its absence during the Champions Trophy final closing ceremony, where India defeated New Zealand. Despite the presence of PCB officials at the venue, protocol dictated only the heads of cricket boards were allowed on stage, leaving Pakistan unrepresented. ICC have now issued a statement after reports of PCB lodging an official protest.

title: Sports Ministry lifts suspension of Indian wrestling federation
content: The Sports Ministry has lifted the suspension of the Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) and restored its recognition. WFI president Sanjay Singh now has full control. The ministry issued directions for balanced decision-making and the adherence to selection and governance rules. All changes made during the suspension must be reverted within 4 weeks.

title: Devotees flock to Sambhal temple to worship potato with ‘4 Vishnu avatars’
content: A potato found in Bareilly, bearing shapes resembling four avatars of Lord Vishnu, has been placed at Tulsi Manas Temple in Sambhal. The spud has attracted significant attention, with many devotees interpreting it as a divine sign, especially just before the Holi festival.

title: US Intel chief Tulsi Gabbard to visit India during her Indo-Pacific trip
content: US National Intelligence Director Tulsi Gabbard will visit the Indo-Pacific region, including India, to build strong relationships and open communication lines. This marks the first visit by a top White House official to India under the Trump administration, following PM Modi's US visit, where he met Gabbard and discussed enhancing bilateral intelligence cooperation.

title: No commitment to US on tariffs: Govt to Parlimantary panel
content: The Indian government has clarified that no commitments were made to the US on reducing tariffs, despite Donald Trump's claims. Commerce Secretary Sunil Barthwal informed a parliamentary panel that India and the US are working towards a mutually beneficial trade agreement, addressing long-term cooperation over immediate tariff adjustments. He assured lawmakers that India's interests would be protected in the negotiations.

title: 'Tremendous amount of money being sent ... ': Musk reveals why DOGE targeted USAID
content: Elon Musk targeted USAID, highlighting financial waste and corruption, particularly in NGO funding. His team pushed for transparency and reforms in USAID and the Treasury, with Marco Rubio confirming major implementations of their suggestions. Critics argue about the legality of the cuts and potential risks to essential aid programs.

title: Rohit Sharma's perfect 'stump toss' stuns Dubai after Champions Trophy win
content: Rohit Sharma led India to a historic ICC Champions Trophy 2025 victory, securing their second ICC trophy in nine months with a thrilling win over New Zealand. He ended retirement speculations, affirming his intention to continue in the ODI format, leaving fans with an iconic celebration. Their previous triumph came in June 2024 when they defeated South Africa in the T20 World Cup final in Barbados.

title: How Varun Chakravarthy evolved to become India’s X-factor
content: India faced a potential setback in the Champions Trophy with Jasprit Bumrah's absence but turned to mystery spinner Varun Chakravarthy. Varun delivered outstanding performances, taking five wickets against New Zealand and crucial strikes in knockout matches, helping India win the title. His unique bowling and mental toughness earned praise and made him a key player.

title: As debt mounts, Maharashtra cuts Ladki funds, stalls loan waiver
content: The state's first Budget after Mahayuti govt's win reveals a record-high debt of Rs 9.3 lakh crore and a revenue deficit of Rs 45,891 crore for 2025-26. No new major schemes are introduced, focusing instead on existing ones. Local body poll budget allocations have increased, and new taxes are proposed to generate Rs 1,125 crore revenue.

title: Dogs of war: Russian rumble makes Ukraine top arms buyer
content: Ukraine surpassed India as the world's top arms importer in 2020-24, with its imports rising significantly due to its war with Russia. India's arms imports, driven by tensions with China and Pakistan, accounted for 8.3% of global imports. India's imports from Russia decreased, while imports from France and Israel increased.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for March 11
content: Somil Mehta from Mirae Asset Sharekhan recommends buying HUL and SBI Card stocks today. HUL shows a positive trend with a target of Rs 2420, while SBI Card is anticipated to break out upwards with a target of Rs 940. Consult a financial advisor before investing.

title: Elon Musk claims 'cyberattack' on X originated from 'Ukraine area'
content: Tech billionaire and DOGE head Elon Musk revealed that X faced a significant cyberattack originating from the Ukraine area, causing widespread service disruptions. Thousands of users reported issues, with outages peaking early Monday morning and continuing intermittently throughout the day. The attack suggests involvement from a large, coordinated group or a country.

title: Pope Francis's condition improves, no imminent danger to life, says Vatican
content: Pope Francis's condition has improved, and doctors no longer fear for his life, though he is expected to remain hospitalized for further treatment. The Vatican confirmed the 88-year-old pontiff's health is stable, and he has been responsive to treatments, including physical and respiratory therapy.

title: 'India Cha Raja!' Rohit Sharma gets thunderous welcome in Mumbai
content: Gautam Gambhir and Rohit Sharma returned to India with the team after their Champions Trophy victory in Dubai. Gambhir landed in Delhi, while Rohit arrived in Mumbai. The team's return was subdued as players prepare for the IPL 2025 season, commencing on March 22. Rohit reached Mumbai around 8 PM, accompanied by his wife, who had been in Dubai supporting him during the final.

title: Sun Pharma to acquire US oncology company for over Rs 3,000 crore
content: Sun Pharma, India's largest pharmaceutical company, is set to acquire Checkpoint Therapeutics for $355 million. This strategic acquisition will enhance Sun Pharma's specialty portfolio, including UNLOXCYT, an FDA-approved treatment for advanced skin cancer, expanding its global presence in oncology treatments.

title: Modi ‘my favourite actor’, says Rajasthan CM, gives Congress anti-PM ammo
content: Rajasthan CM Bhajan Lal Sharma caused a political stir by referring to PM Narendra Modi as his favourite actor. Congress used this to criticize Modi, claiming the PM is more of an actor than a leader. BJP defended Modi, asserting the question was about a 'hero.' The dispute gained significant attention on social media.

title: 12 years after life term, SC acquits Tamil Nadu man of burning wife to death
content: Twelve years after a man was sentenced to life imprisonment for allegedly burning his wife to death in Tamil Nadu, the apex court has acquitted him. The court noted inconsistencies in the dying declarations of the deceased and the absence of substantial evidence against the accused. The bench emphasized the need for corroborative evidence when dying declarations are contradictory.

title: Chahal's outing amid divorce with Dhanashree: Top 5 entertainment news
content: The entertainment world is buzzing with major updates! From Yuzvendra Chahal’s outing with RJ Mahvash amid his divorce from Dhanashree Verma to Govinda revealing he was thrown out of BR Chopra’s office, and Akshay Kumar selling his Mumbai apartment—here are the top five entertainment stories of the day that have everyone talking!

title: Protection of personal data part of right to privacy: Gavai
content: Justice B R Gavai emphasized the integral role of personal data protection in the digital age as part of the right to privacy and life. Addressing challenges like misinformation, online harassment, and emerging technologies, he highlighted the need for judiciaries in developing countries to define limits on digital rights and governmental regulation.

title: ED searches Baghel, son’s premises in Chhattisgarh booze scam
content: ED conducted searches at former Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel's premises in connection with a Rs 2,161 crore liquor scam and money laundering involving his son Chaitanya. Assets worth Rs 205 crore have been attached. The searches led to the discovery of significant cash and documents implicating various individuals.

title: File report on need for Sambhal masjid whitewash: HC to ASI
content: The Allahabad High Court has directed the ASI to provide a detailed reply regarding the necessity of whitewashing, extra lighting, and decorative lights outside the Jama Masjid in Sambhal, Uttar Pradesh. The directive follows a petition by the mosque management and highlights the need for further examination by ASI experts.

title: LeBron James caught ranting to Richard Jefferson about Stephen Smith
content: LeBron James was caught on camera expressing frustration over comments made by Stephen A. Smith regarding his son, Bronny. The incident highlights the emotional stress faced by athletes and their families. Smith addressed the issue, understanding James's reaction as a father. The hot mic moment revealed the raw emotions behind James's public statements.

title: Opposition demands discussion on 'voter list discrepancies'
content: Leader of the House J P Nadda expressed the government's readiness to discuss any issue but criticized the opposition for attempting to disrupt proceedings through Rule 267. He condemned their walkout and reassured that there will be opportunities for discussions during the Union Budget debates over the next 10 days.
